page.title: 10Changes in Shilton.
page.content: {Shilton}has lost many of its amenities in the past{30 years.In 1957}the {Railway Station}was closed.Previously people from{Shilton}could get to{Rugby easily . All except one of the village shops have closed down.{30 years ago there were{5 shops}including a{Butcher}and {Cobbler.}Now because people can get to {Coventry}by car the shops have closed. Up to 5 years ago{Shilton}had a {Doctor's surgery,}1 day a week.Now people have to go to{Bulkington}or {Coventry}for treatment. In the 1920s the{Parish council}bought a cottage and land which was part of the{cemetry.}The cottage was converted in the 1980s by the{Manpower services} commission into the{Parish Council {Office. Mrs Thom,}the secretary to the Council collects items to remind people of{Shilton's}past.
